doc.field: Series XIII: Collected Film and Audio Library
Series XIII: Collected Film and Audio Library
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records

The subseries contains 421 film reels. The bulk of the films are 16mm, but other formats include 8mm, Super 8, and 35mm. These films largely consist of exhibition prints of foreign documentaries, the majority of which are in Russian, and feature on topics regarding Soviet history and life in the Soviet Union. Most films were produced between the 1970s and 1980s, but several were produced as early as 1935. Other languages include Korean, Spanish, German, Czech, Chinese, and Vietnamese, with only a small portion of films in English. Several films include amateur footage of public events including May Day demonstrations and Communist Party election rallies. Amateur footage also features travels to socialist countries by members of the Communist Party in the 1960s, the trial of Angela Davis, and footage of election campaigns in the 1970s and 1980s. Many of these reels are poorly labeled and lack clear information about dates or content, and some cannot be identified.

Film titles have been derived from annotations on the original containers. In several cases foreign language titles were translated into English to provide more information about the content of the films. English titles are literal translations, and are followed by original titles in parenthesis.
